quotes.quote: I'm drinking so much water but I still feel like crap
quotes.notes: High-frequency complaint in keto communities. Classic electrolyte depletion symptom described in natural language.

quotes.quote: My brain fog literally disappeared after 3 days
quotes.notes: Strong result claim. Would need verification for ad use. Common theme across electrolyte reviews.

quotes.quote: How is this different from the $10 stuff at CVS?
quotes.notes: Core objection. Must be addressed in landing page, FAQ, and ad creative. Differentiation messaging critical.

quotes.quote: I just want to feel like I did in my 20s
quotes.notes: Deep emotional desire. Powerful for long-form copy and VSL. Resonates broadly across segments.

quotes.quote: Tastes like chemicals and didn't do anything
quotes.notes: Common competitor complaint. Double pain point: taste AND efficacy. Use in comparison ads and landing page.

quotes.quote: I was so tired by 2pm every day I could barely function
quotes.notes: Extremely relatable problem statement. Specific time (2pm) makes it vivid. Strong ad hook potential.

quotes.quote: Keto flu hit me like a truck
quotes.notes: Visceral description of keto flu. High emotional impact. One of the most validated pain points in VOC corpus.

quotes.quote: I drink so much water but I still feel dehydrated
quotes.notes: The hydration paradox is a core educational angle. People don't understand that water without minerals doesn't hydrate properly.

quotes.quote: My brain fog finally cleared up
quotes.notes: Brain fog resolution is a top reported benefit. Strong testimonial for landing page and email sequences.

quotes.quote: I actually have energy past 3pm now
quotes.notes: Specific time reference makes it relatable. Pairs well with VOC-006 (the problem statement) for before/after narrative.

quotes.quote: Why didn't anyone tell me about this sooner
quotes.notes: Powerful social proof quote. Implies the product exceeded expectations. Works in ads, emails, and landing page.

quotes.quote: Tastes way better than I expected
quotes.notes: Addresses taste objection proactively. 'Better than expected' framing lowers the bar and sets up positive surprise.
